website_summaries.verdict: High-quality cacao powder that's organic, gluten-free, and vegan.
pros: Makes use of a strain of Criollo cacao beans, which some people prefer, as it's rarer than other cacao beans
Has a strong flavor and aroma that people love
Great source of magnesium and dietary fiber
Easy to add to nearly any recipe
cons: Some concerns about quality control in the packaging

customer_reviews.title: Homemade Chocolate/Banana Ice Cream!!!
customer_reviews.text: I love this cacao powder. It's organic, it has a very fine powdered texture and has a really nice cacao flavor to it. I freeze banana chunks on a cookie sheet in the freezer and put them in my NutriBullet with some cacao powder and a handful of cacao nibs. I use almond milk as the liquid and I blend with a drizzle of raw honey until I have banana chocolate ice cream. I crush raw walnuts on top and enjoy. My husband loves this as well. So nutritious! If this review was helpful to you in any way, please let me know by clicking on helpful. Thank you so much!! :)
customer_reviews.author: phillygrl

customer_reviews.title: Not worth it - also causes cancer?
customer_reviews.text: Has a big old warning on it about causing cancer and reproductive harm, but it DOES NOT SAY WHICH cancer causing chemical it contains, even though it is supposed to. The P65 website it directs you to says that products that require this warning should include the name of the chemical of concern in the products. On top of that, every time someone asks which cancer causing chemicals this product contains here in the Amazon Q&A, some dude just directs them to the website. In addition to the whole little cancer issue, honestly this cacao just made my smoothie taste gross. I definitely don't recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: DCVs

Like all pure cocoas, to make hot cocoa, you need to mix it with about a 1/4 cup more or less of very hot water then add the hot milk. (I add cold milk and put it in the microwave). If you just add the cocoa to hot or cold milk the cocoa won't dissolve completely.

customer_reviews.title: Very smooth, full taste
customer_reviews.text: I routinely add cacao (cocoa when I don't have cacao) to my coffee. Since I brew pots of coffee, I add it with the grounds rather than directly in the cup so blending isn't usually an issue unless I'm making a pot to share. The few times I have omitted it from the ground coffee and added it to a cup, it has blended smoothly with no clumping. It adds a lovely fullness to the mouth-feel and taste of the coffee (and I'm a bit of a coffee snob). The aroma is great, too. I love opening the bag an breathing in that chocolate scent.

customer_reviews.title: Cancer and Reproductive Harm Sticker on container....

While cadmium is most likely the culprit, the company is mum. While it may or may not be an actual issue outside of California's Prop. 65 guidelines, at least provide the testing data, so people can decide for themselves.

customer_reviews.title: Rich and delicious
customer_reviews.text: Really enjoying it. I use it to make hot cocoa adding only hot water, just a splash of milk and only one teaspoon of sugar. It tastes better to me than the usual overly sugary cocoas that often also have artificial sweeteners in them. I also add it to yogurt and put raisins in for sweetness. Adding sunflower seeds somehow fools my taste buds into thinking there are chocolate chips! So, good for the health benefits as well as cutting down on sugar and calories. Some say you should not heat it, so I wait till the hot water cools down a bit before pouring. Don't know if that helps.
customer_reviews.author: Merri-Lilac

customer_reviews.title: Makes great keto friendly hot cocoa
customer_reviews.text: This cacao powder is great quality. I’ve used it to make homemade keto friendly hot cocoa and it’s been amazing! After reading some reviews, it seems that many of the negative reviewers do not understand exactly what they’re purchasing or how to use this product. My recipe for creamy, deli hot coos this: 1 cup unsweetened almond milk 2 TBSP heavy cream 2 TBSP powdered monkfruit sweetener 1 TBSP cacao powder 1/2 tsp vanilla Whisk all the ingredients together in a small saucepan over low heat until hot.
customer_reviews.author: KDiaz

customer_reviews.title: Much nicer than "Dutched" cocoa
customer_reviews.text: I had previously tried using cocoa (for its health benefits) bought in the grocery store, but didn't really like it (very bitter, so had to add lots of sugar). This product is COMPLETELY different! It's not heat-processed and is NOT bitter at all; it dissolves very well and stays in solution better, so no more wasted powder at the bottom of the cup; also the taste is delicious. Very economical too compared to buying small containers--I plan to put it on auto shipment. Very happy with this product and highly recommend it.

Now it is the only one I buy.

customer_reviews.title: Love this Cacao powder!
customer_reviews.text: Love this Cacao powder! I was buying Hershey's unsweetened cacao before discovering the Viva brand. The first time I used this I noticed a more rich, chocolately taste. I love that this is an organic product too. This is my new cacao for my Nutriblasts in the morning. If you have a nutribullet, try this: a handful of baby spinach, 1 ripe banana, a few frozen strawberries, some frozen blueberries, a small amount of walnuts, a tablespoon of this Cacao powder, and fill to the line with almond milk - YUMMMM!!!!! It is so healthy and yet you think you are drinking a chocolate shake for breakfast.

All they taste is chocolate and they are in! I really feel like it gives me a nice energy boost too which is an added bonus. That’s just an added benefit on top of all of the antioxidants, iron, calcium, and magnesium! This is a quality cacoa and I highly recommend it. Ditch your cocoa for cacoa!!

customer_reviews.title: I have actually learned to enjoy coffee basically black with no added sugar

It has made a world of difference. Definitely use it sparingly because it is a bit bitter at first. I used to be one who would pile on all the sugar and cream and then maybe have a pinch of coffee in my cup. By using this, I have actually learned to enjoy coffee basically black with no added sugar! I still haven't used it in baking or shakes, but will eventually. This bag is huge too so it lasts a LONG time!

customer_reviews.title: Good Tasting Cocoa, but Not Over the Moon
customer_reviews.text: I bought this based on all the glowing reviews and the heavy metal testing they have done, which alleges to show lower levels of lead and cadmium. This has an interesting flavor, more complex than common cocoa like Hershey's. However, once in awhile when I open the bag, I detect the slightest "musty" odor. I know cacao beans are dried in the sun and fermented, so that might be the cause of it. We are enjoying hot cocoa with this cold weather, but I don't know if I'll buy it again when this bag is finished.
customer_reviews.author: Merci

customer_reviews.title: Cancer and reproductive harm
customer_reviews.text: On the back there is a sticker with a cancer and reproductive harm warning that is not shown in the pictures. Terrible. I refunded the two I bought and it’s a return less refund. I think I’ll end up throwing away cause I bought for a birthday and I don’t want to be giving them this kind of stuff.
customer_reviews.author: Art Wonders

customer_reviews.title: Compared with 3 other brands
customer_reviews.text: I bought three different brands of organic cacao. Tablespoon for tablespoon, this brand exceeds the rest. One brand mixed with a grainy taste, my second best brand did not seem as rich in taste and slightly more bitter, and this brand was the best. I usually use 3 tbs. of cacao and one tb. of sugar, along with almond milk and a portion of fruit. Delicious, healthy shake!
customer_reviews.author: Satisfied customr.

customer_reviews.title: Viva Naturals makes the best cacao that I've had, so far. It is now my new brand.
customer_reviews.text: I have been drinking hot cacao instead of coffee in the morning for the past year. I buy a different brand every time to compare the different tastes. I just had my first cup Viva Naturals cacao. The aroma and flavor are unexpectedly rich and delicious! It tastes and smells almost like chocolate! I'm going to stick with this brand for a while. Recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Milford Gal

customer_reviews.title: My Favorite Ever
customer_reviews.text: I love this I've been purchasing this for how many times now and still going to order again and again Love this on my smoothie and on my breakfast hot cacao drink Yummy
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Product is almost expired.
customer_reviews.text: The expiration date is approaching too soon (within 5 months from the purchase date). I tried to return the item but ended up exchanging it for the new one. The second item I got also almost expired and Amazon won't let me return it. I am really disappointed and won't buy this product from Amazon again.
customer_reviews.author: gobbie

customer_reviews.title: Difficult to close bag
customer_reviews.text: While I found flavor OK, my spouse found it lacking compared to others we've tried. The biggest issue was simply closing the bag. I would try 2 or 3 times and simply could not get the tiny grooves to line-up correctly. I don't need the frustration.
customer_reviews.author: Wm

customer_reviews.title: Very good cacao powder
customer_reviews.text: I bought this in place of cocoa powder to see which one I liked better. I really like this product. Smells very chocolate-y and is a nice bright chocolate color. I’ve been using this in my Keto mug cakes and it works very well. You don’t need very much to get a good chocolate flavor. I generally use half of the amount of cocoa powder a recipe calls for and it works fine. It has a very fine ground texture and mixes well too. I will probably continue to buy this product when I run out. Recommended!
customer_reviews.author: AnniebelleTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Unusual brief stomach pain
customer_reviews.text: I still have a full bag because for some reason my stomach pained me whenever I used it. Not sure why the package was in tact and product looked fresh. I do want to say the stomach pain was brief but made me not want to use it. That was just my experience. It is supposed to be healthy I have purchased this in the chips form or chocolate bar from other sellers.
customer_reviews.author: Marsha J

customer_reviews.title: Seems like decent premium cocoa powder.
customer_reviews.text: I usually buy Hershey's cocoa powder, this seems pretty comfortable to that in terms of freshness and taste. But I wasn't blowing but I wasn't blown away or anything like that.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron

customer_reviews.title: Love it helped me so much cutting my sugar cravings
customer_reviews.text: Cutting down on my sugars and cravings.. just 15 calories, very nice taste, if you mix with oatmeal and other things put it at freezer for a quick and healthy desert... I am over chocolate and I keep reading cacao is so good for you.. Buying second time
customer_reviews.author: Ayca

customer_reviews.title: Mixes well in different ways...
customer_reviews.text: Delivered on time, as described and would / will buy again. This powder mixes well with coconut milk too, if you don't want to stir it in as long into a cold drink, we mix the powder in warm/hot tap water and it turns into a great thick syrup quickly to pour into cold drinks. An example would be we put 2 tablespoons of Cacao powder in a 6oz glass, add it half full with warmer to hot tap water and then stir... Experiment with the ratios as needed then pour into the other drink (milk, coconut milk etc...). Cheers!
customer_reviews.author: Mike Koval

customer_reviews.title: Good and fresh
customer_reviews.text: I love rich and minimally processed cacao powder for my daily smoothies. I mix cacao with lava powder, cod liver oil, and a banana. This superfood is becoming harder to find at grocery stores so I’m pleased to have options on Amazon. It was a little overwhelming comparing brands, price, size and quality but this one seemed reasonable, reputable and competitively priced. This brand tastes great and it is fresh.
customer_reviews.author: Ben W.

customer_reviews.title: The BEST cacao powder I've ever tried!
customer_reviews.text: This may very well be "The BEST Tasting Certified Organic Cacao Powder" as it says in the product title. I was pleasantly surprised by the enticing cacao aroma when I just opened the package. Usually plain cacao powders smell pretty much like dust or dirt, not this one! I use a spoonful of it in my morning smoothies and it makes any smoothie taste deliciously 'chocolatey'. I was also surprised by the amount of powder in the bag - it's a lot! Even with daily smoothies, it will probably last me several months. I am very happy about this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Natalia H.

customer_reviews.title: Best cacao powder
customer_reviews.text: I tried about five other brands of cacao powder in the past, and Viva is hands down the best. Its powder is fine like powdered sugar. Other cacao powder is dry and always created a cloud of cocoa dust in the air. But Viva’s cacao is fresh, so it is “moist.” I don’t have to inhale cacao dust anymore. The flavor is rich and tasty. I highly recommend it!
customer_reviews.author: Nechan

customer_reviews.title: Viva natural organic  cacao
customer_reviews.text: Tasted great until I saw the cancer warning.. How can something that's "Oragnic" and "Natural" as they claim cause reproductive harm and have a cancer warning. SMH
customer_reviews.author: Neeners503

customer_reviews.title: Tastes great, but the resealable bag is terrible
customer_reviews.text: I wish I could give this 5 stars, since it tastes great and blends well, but the resealable bag is terrible. Make sure you have a large bag clip on hand because it will be the only way to reseal it. Otherwise, I love the taste and texture of this cacao powder much more than Hershey's brand.
customer_reviews.author: ballroomchik

customer_reviews.title: Deelish!
customer_reviews.text: This stuff is delicious. Super rich and bitter, and can be dressed up to you taste with milk or cream and some sugar or stevia. Throw some other spices in like cinnamon, ginger, or even some cayenne, and you've got yourself a great hot drink. Dissolves way better in hot water than the major cocoa powder (I know this is cacao, but I've commonly used cocoa powder) brands.
customer_reviews.author: Ceymiz

customer_reviews.title: Love it but...
customer_reviews.text: Definitely buying this again. The only thing that concerned me is the warning level on the back about exposure of some sort and possible cancer. Idk that part is the only thing that hase iffy about buying again.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Good buy!
customer_reviews.text: After the SIP, I ran out of my usual chocolate powder and tried to buy it but no luck. Glad that I found this! I have used this to make chocolate rice pudding, chocolate cake, etc...It tastes good and blends well. Highly recommend & will buy again for sure.
customer_reviews.author: JM

customer_reviews.title: Grown in Peru
customer_reviews.text: Cacao beans are sometimes grown in less desirable locations (i.e. Nigeria and other countries) with pollution issues that increase the presence of heavy metals in the bean. Fortunately, Viva Naturals "cacao beans are grown and processed in Peru 🙂" (a direct quote from the seller). Great company, responsive, and transparent. Thank you!
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: Delicious and healthy
customer_reviews.text: Superfood. Did you know cacao has 20 times the antioxidants that blueberries have? Cacao can improve your memory, serve as an antidepressant, reduce heart disease, shed fat, boost immunity, and create vast energy. And it tastes great! I recently gave up carbs and sugar, but everyone has to have a treat now and then... mine is a "pudding" made with unsweetened coconut milk, chia seeds, and cacao powder - it is AMAZING! I love that this cacao powder is organic, too - it's important to me that what i put in my body is healthy and clean.
customer_reviews.author: S Richardson

customer_reviews.title: Cacao without sugar
customer_reviews.text: Very good, not sweet AT ALL Organic Cacao powder. My husband and I started a very low carb, high protein and high good fat diet, which has been quite successful to date. This cacao powder has no sugar and tastes wonderfully when put into my Greek yogurt "creations" (along with protein powder, cinnamon, etc). That is all I use it for, but I'm sure it would be great in recipes. As I'm sure you know, chocolate has many health benefits, unless it's full of sugar. This isn't.
customer_reviews.author: Sany123Top Contributor: Coloring

customer_reviews.title: I would not recommend.
customer_reviews.text: I have not tried this Cacao powder as of yet and I might not use it. On the back there is a stamp WARNING! Cancer and reproductive harm and gives a website for reference. Also the expiration date is blurred and I cannot tell if it is Jan. 2020 or June 2020. Either way, not a long shelf life considering how seldom I'll use it.
customer_reviews.author: Beverly J. Dike

customer_reviews.title: Made me wired but I love the product
customer_reviews.text: I'm not sure of the amount of caffeine in here but I researched cacao and it says less than chocolate but this stuff made me wired! I can only have it before noon and no more than 1 Tbsp. I add it to my smoothie with the PB FIT powder. Once I realized that it had this zinging effect and changed the time I have it and it made a difference. P.S. I am extremely sensitive to caffeine and cannot even drink decaf after noon or I will be up until 3 am.
customer_reviews.author: Noelleinaz

customer_reviews.title: P65 warning
customer_reviews.text: I really like the taste of this product. I bought it several times. It is supposed to a healthy food. However, on the most recent purchase, i noticed that it has a label stating Cancer and Reproductive Harm.. P65 warning on the back of the package (not sure whether it had been there all the time but i just didn't notice it). After seeing the warning label, I no longer want to consume this product.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Cacao Powder
customer_reviews.text: What I liked: -Delicious flavor (I've tried other brands from supermarkets and they were very bitter) -Blends great in coffee--I use it in my coffee every day now -Large bag which will last a while -Zip-close bag works well There really wasn't anything I didn't like.
customer_reviews.author: Bob

customer_reviews.title: Delicious Rich Chocolate That Mixes Very Well.
customer_reviews.text: oh my goodness. this cacoa powder is extremely rich and chocolatety. i use it in all of my low carb treats and it really delivers the taste. i'm so glad i found this product.
customer_reviews.author: Loyal Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: No G.I. issues
customer_reviews.text: I have tried several brands over the past 2 years in my daily breakfast shake. I've used this for 3 weeks now and it hasn't caused me stomach issues or headaches like the other brands. The only small problem is the packaging. It has an inner ziplock type seal, that simply will not seal all the way. To keep it fresh I roll it over, clip it and then place in another airtight bag. Tastes really good and blends smooth.
customer_reviews.author: chellebelle

customer_reviews.title: Clumps really bad in hot chocolate.
customer_reviews.text: The taste is amazing, but the cacao clumps like you wouldn't believe. Makes miserable hot chocolate with bitter clumps throughout. I don't recall having this issue with the first bag, but the second has been unbearable. I love the taste, but I'll probably try some other brands before coming back to this. 5 stars for the taste, 1 star for smoothness in hot cocoa, so I'm rounding up the rating to 3 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Bitter. I frequently use cacao and this is the ...
customer_reviews.text: Bitter. I frequently use cacao and this is the most chalky and bitter cacao I've yet tried. Non-returnable so I'm definitely unhappy.
customer_reviews.author: JV

customer_reviews.title: Makes tasty hot chocolate!
customer_reviews.text: This cacao powder met/exceeded our expectations. We have made hot chocolate with it, adding organic coconut milk, a little bit of organic cinnamon and some Stevia. It is delicious. Only one caution: "less if more." We used 2 tablespoons for the hot chocolate and it was too rich. Suggest experimenting and start with one tablespoon. I'm thrilled we found this healthy alternative to the processed stuff that is loaded with preservatives and sugar.
customer_reviews.author: Barbara Melton Perkins

customer_reviews.title: Cancer warning sticker???
customer_reviews.text: I love this product but was upset when I saw this “cancer” sticker on it. PLEASE EXPLAIN
customer_reviews.author: shelliejt

customer_reviews.title: If you love adding quality chocolate to everything...
customer_reviews.text: ehh..., I'm not sure what I was expecting, I'm not a huge fan of chocolate in my coffee and don't really like it in smoothies, so I'm not certain that I'll be using too much of this any time soon. However the quality seems fine and the price was acceptable
customer_reviews.author: Sally A. Birdsong

customer_reviews.title: Worth the money
customer_reviews.text: This is a very large amount of organic cocoa powder for a great price. Just used it for a banana smoothie and it tastes amazing. It is fresh and not clumpy, which is a great sign :) Seller also shipped this out quickly! thank you so very much
customer_reviews.author: Khiem Nguyen

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: This product from Viva is a great product. I use cacao powder when a bake and was looking for a healthy one. It tastes good and is excellent to use in baking as well as sprinkling on ice cream or yogurt. It's well worth the price. I would recommend this product to others.
customer_reviews.author: DEW

customer_reviews.title: One of the better tasting Cacao powders
customer_reviews.text: I'm on my third bag. It's slightly dryer than a standard cocoa powder, so some recipes may require more liquid. I make shakes, cakes, cookies...etc. with it and it's a good product.
customer_reviews.author: Flippy McDurfkin

customer_reviews.title: It really blends in liquid without a blender!
customer_reviews.text: Cacao really is different from cocoa: It has 2 'a's, and cocoa has 2 o's!! But seriously, cacao blends into hot coffee, almond milk, and a protein drink without the need of a blender, or a whisk. The taste is marvelous!!
customer_reviews.author: K. Zebra

customer_reviews.title: Magic! This stuff is SOOOOO GOOD!
customer_reviews.text: This is amazing and I love it!!! I’m eating a plant based diet and this added to any plant based milk and cooked farro with ice, makes an amazing chocolate shake! A treat that’s good for you! 5 grams of fiber per serving! Plus, more antioxidants than eating a gallon of blueberries! Use it as a crazy good fiber supplement that’s pure and no fillers or additives like fiber pills. This stuff is magic!
customer_reviews.author: CJS

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful scent when opening the bag
customer_reviews.text: The scent of cacao would waft from the bag every time it was opened. The texture was incredibly smooth and the flavor was incredible. I would blend it in a protein smoothie and it enhanced the drink giving it a delicious chocolate-like flavor.
customer_reviews.author: BuckyMax

customer_reviews.title: Lied About Their Serving Count
customer_reviews.text: The product itself is fine but the company lies about the servings per container. I use the image of the serving size companies provide in their Amazon listing. If you look at the serving count image for this product it says 181 Servings when the product came to my possession it now says 91 servings. I won’t be purchasing from this brand again unless I get an explanation for why that photo is still up there.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher Chao

product_meta.title: Viva Naturals #1 Best Selling Certified Organic Cacao Powder from Superior Criollo Beans, 1 LB Bag
product_meta.description: See what our customers are saying!“Open the bag and breath deep... not too deep, don't want cacao powder up your nose... or, do you? This cacao powder is so delicious in anything you want to make chocolate!”“It's *LICK THE SPOON* good”“This stuff is a screaming good deal. It's top-quality cacao with the deep rich flavor of the best beans.”What is Cacao?Revered for its natural energizing and wholesome properties, cacao powder is renowned as one of the world's most powerful superfoods. Viva Naturals Organic Cacao Powder instantly transforms desserts, smoothies and other treats into guilt-free bliss.Why Choose Viva Naturals Organic Cacao PowderAntioxidantsA study published by the American Heart Association compared the flavonoid content of several different foods, including tea, fruits and vegetables. Cacao exhibited almost 8 times the amount of flavonoids as black tea, in addition to surpassing all other foods studied.UnprocessedUnlike conventional cocoa powder or chocolate, cacao powder is unprocessed and contains no added sugars, retaining its full-bodied nutrition profile. Our cacao powder is produced at low temperatures to ensure an unaltered organic product.The Viva Naturals DifferenceTo preserve its flavor and maximum nutritional value, our cacao powder is made from premium organic unroasted cacao beans harvested in the warm, climate regions of Peru. Criollo beans are one of three variations of cacao, recognizably the purest and rarest beans, hailed for their delectable chocolate flavor and aroma. These prized beans are carefully pressed and ground into a cake-like paste and slowly grinded into a fine, delicate powder at low temperatures releasing the flavorful precursors of luscious chocolate. Viva Naturals Organic Cacao Powder is Non-GMO Project Certified and is sustainably sourced in accordance with fair trade practices.
